text:
This is a 66 yr old female (Indian speaking), who was admitted via the
   ED from an OSH (on [**Location (un) 1479**]), where she presented w/ c/o difficulty
   breathing and chest pain for a couple of days. She was dx
ed with
   cardiomyopathy at the OSH. Here, her CXR was notable for bilateral
   pleural effusions with e/o pulmonary edema, and pneumonia could not be
   excluded. While in the ED, she was noted to have a BP of 78/38 with a
   HR of 76; she was given 2L IVF with improvement in BP. She was also
   noted to have worsening mental status and became more lethargic with
   this drop in blood pressure. She was tx
ed to MICU 6 for further care.
   While in the MICU, she has remained lethargic. In addition, her HCT has
   dropped (requiring tx of 1 unit PRBC) and her ARF has worsened. PMH sig
   for: HCV Cirrhosis (s/p TIPS) and HCC.
   Hepatic encephalopathy
   Assessment:
   Pt remains somnolent, but arousable to voice/stimulation (she appears
   to be more alert than yesterday). She remains non-verbal, but is
   intermittently following commands for family members. [**Name (NI) 2288**].
   Action:
   Pt receiving Lactulose and Rifaximin ATC per orders; reoriented
   frequently.
   Response:
   Flexiseal draining moderate amts of stool; pt
s mental status slowly
   improving throughout the day.
   Plan:
   Continue Lactulose/Rifaximin per orders; continue to reorient pt
   frequently.
   Anemia, hemolytic
   Assessment:
   Pt required tx of 1 unit PRBC yesterday (for HCT drop down to 25.7)
   Action:
   Response:
   Plan:
   Pneumonia, other
   Assessment:
   Pt with likely PNA on cxr; pt w/o increased WBC or fever
   Action:
   Response:
   Plan:
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   Pt with elevated BUN/Cr and very marginal output.
   Action:
   Response:
   Plan:
